label.search-placeholder: Search for a place... (⌘ or Ctrl + K)
label.use-current-location: Use current location (⌘ or Ctrl + ⇧ Shift + P)

text.calculation-availability: Only available in single fuel search
text.location-search:
Search for a specific address or use your current location.

Your input will be passed to OpenStreetMap (Nominatim) if you directly search via address.
text.n-places-found: {count, plural, =0 {No places found.} one {One place found.} other {# Places found.}}
text.n-stations-found: {count, plural, =0 {No stations found.} one {One station found.} other {# stations found.}}
text.n-stations-shown:
{count, plural, one {One} other {#}}
of {total, plural, one {one station is} other {# stations are}} shown
text.short-explanation: Find out within a few seconds, which gas station in your area is actually the cheapest.
text.tracking-note:
Note: Following data can be collected anonymously:

  • Country
  • Operating System and App-Version
  • Following Click-Events:
    • Selected Language and Theme
    • Position search (automatic and manual)
    • Car configuration
    • Installation as App
    • Opening of sorting and filtering
    • Selection of fuel
    • Selection of search radius
text.your-car:
Configure your car for the profitability calculation of a tank trip.

You only need to enter your average fuel consumption and tank volume.
text.your-filter:
You can also filter your search to only get specific fuels within a given area.

The calculation of your total cost is only available in single fuel search.
